meta.name: description
meta.content: Information and articles related to Rapise, our automated functional and cross-browser testing solution

h5.a: UIAutomation2 Locator

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Rapise 6.3 includes an experimental feature - new UIAutomation2 locator for UIAtuomation based desktop testing. Rather than specifying a path from the element tree root to the element this locator relies on built-in ability of UIAutomation to search for elements based on property values.

h5.a: How to define and use a dynamic Web locator

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Imaging you have a table with dynamic data on the page. It is not possible to learn every cell. But it is possible to parameterize the locator of a cell and access cells you need during test playback.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Referring Repository Objects from Maps

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Sometimes you need to specify object and data for it in the map. Here we will show how to make it using Rapise built in maps and available APIs.

h5.a: Accessing svg elements via XPath

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: By default straight forward XPath to SVG primitives will not work. So XPath ending like .../svg[2]/path will fail. Here is a workaround.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Passing Map as a Parameter into RVL Sheet

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: This topic covers more detailed description on how to pass map from one Sheet to another in RVL

h5.a: Passing Sub-Test Parameters

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Here we will cover several ways of passing parameters and returning values from Sub-Tests.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to set size of a browser window

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: To ensure that web tests always run on a browser window of a specific size you may use different techniques.

h5.a: Connecting to PostgreSQL from Rapise

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: If you need to connect Database object to PostgreSQL database follow these simple steps.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Connecting to MySQL from Rapise

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: If you need to connect Database object to MySQL database follow these simple steps.

h5.a: Rapise Data Generator

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Sometimes you need to feed your application with demo data that is human-readable but still random. Here is such a generator for Rapise.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Calling NodeJS script from Rapise

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: NodeJS provides a lot of unique features and plethora of features implemented in npm packages. Here we describe how to combine such a script with a Rapise test.

h5.a: Headless Firefox Testing

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Firefox 56+ supports headless mode on Windows. You can use it to Run Rapise tests via Selenium integration.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Rapise Objects and Files Metadata for Code Completion

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Rapise scripts and engine are mostly implemented in JS. Some people prefer to use 3rd party editors for scripting. This is helpful when integrating Rapise tests into bigger development pipeline together with other scripts and config files. Here we explain where information about objects and types is provided for Code Completion/Intellisense support in 3rd party editors.

h5.a: How to Do Mouse Wheel Scroll in Rapise

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Some controls require mouse wheel input. Here is how to do it.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Automatic learning of objects in a Java application

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: If you prefer writing test steps manually in JavaScript then it might be helpful to automatically learn all child objects of a Java application to make them available for scripting.

h5.a: How to Enable JRE Accessibility Only for Tests

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: By default Rapise is using Java Accessibility Bridge by changing some Java Runtime Environment (JRE)-wide configuration files. So all applications using same JRE will use the modified version. If your goal is to have Accessibility only for test runs, then there is another way of doing that.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Comparing Parts of Images

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Sometimes compared images partially differ due to some dynamic part. Here we show how to do partial comparison in this case.

h5.a: Renaming Objects in Rapise

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Good object naming is important for test script clarity and readability. Default names are detected during record/learn session and results sometimes are cumbersome, obscure or irrelevant. Here we show how to give proper names to objects.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to get contents of the HEAD element in a DOM

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: In this article we will get contents of the HEAD element to get the links to all referenced stylesheets. It may be useful if you plan to verify that a set of CSS did not change for a page.

h5.a: Rapise and Citrix/RDP

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: We are getting a lot of questions on how to use Rapise with Citrix and remotely accessed VMs . Here is the answer.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Inspecting custom UI control with UI Automation Spy

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: UI Automation is a default technology for testing desktop applications on Windows. If your application is not .NET or Java then Rapise will turn on UI Automation library during recording. If some elements in your application are not recognized or there are issues with playback of recorded steps then most likely your application is using custom UI controls. You may inspect those controls and send information to Rapise support team to get recommendations on how to proceed with testing.

h5.a: How to Get All Links on the Page with Rapise

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Sometimes you need to go through all links to check something. Here are two ways: JS and RVL of doing it with Rapise.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Viewing Rapise logs in Spira

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: When you execute Rapise tests via Rapise Launcher - test reports and logs are automatically uploaded to Spira. But verbose level is always set to Level 1 by Rapise Launcher. If you need more detailed log set verbose to 2 or 3 in test case properties.

h5.a: Read PDF Text wih Rapise

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Sometimes you need to check that some text is available in the PDF document. Sometimes you need to extract some value from it. So you need access to plain text content of the document. Here we explain how to do it with Rapise.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to run a PowerShell script in Rapise test

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: To run a PowerShell script use Global.DoLaunch action.

h5.a: Using Rapise with Java Web Start Applications

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Rapise supports testing of Java applications. In the case that application is launched using Java Web Start (JWS) additional steps are needed to successfully test an application.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to deal with custom UI Automation controls

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: This article is for those who test a desktop application via UI Automation library. Since desktop applications are frequently built using UI controls from different vendors and the number of such controls available on the market is pretty big (> 1k) - Rapise may not have out-of-the-box support for some controls in your application. For such cases Rapise offers a low level API to navigate UI Automation tree of elements inside an application and read/write element properties. In this tutorial we'll show how to use this API and quickly add minimal support for a custom control.

h5.a: How to check if web element is really visible on screen

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Checking if element is visible on screen may be a tricky task. It's usually not a problem in manual testing but there are nuances when you do test automation.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to check if a web dropdown element has specific option or not

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: If a test needs to verify existence or absence of a specific option in a dropdown you can do it via a simple function presented below.

h5.a: How to start Rapise Launcher on Windows Boot

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Windows may reboot because of various reasons. If you use a machine to run Rapise tests on regular basis than you want Rapise Launcher to be started automatically after system reboot.
The most reliable method that works with any Windows edition is to use Task Scheduler.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to organize custom code in User.js

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Every test has a User.js file and it is a place to put custom code and functions. This code must follow a few rules.

h5.a: Working Directory of a Test and Relative Paths

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: When Rapise starts execution of a test it sets working directory. If a test refers to a file using a relative path then the absolute path is calculated using the working directory.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to create a Rapise web object from XPath

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: In some cases it may be convenient to construct Rapise Objects dynamically rather than capture in advance with record/learn. In Web tests you can do it via Navigator.Find.

h5.a: Getting browser console logs

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: In some cases it may be useful to analyze browser-side logs. For example, if you are using Navigator.ExecJS action.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to get title of a window

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: In this short topic we describe how to get the value of a window title. The way depends on the application type.

h5.a: Closing application under test from Rapise

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: There are different techniques one can use to close the application being tested from Rapise. The method to choose may depend on the application type.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Troubleshooting Rapise Install

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: If you install Rapise on non-vanilla system, e.g. old workstation with a lot of other software, especially with anti-virus and development tools, it may end-up in a state when some components are not registered successfully and some files are blocked. In this article we describe symptoms and ways to cure.

h5.a: Troubleshooting Rapise Uninstall

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: In the unlikely case of unsuccessful deinstallation of Rapise (e.g. if computer power switched off during deinstallation, or Windows Installer process terminated) there is a way to manually fix the system and complete interrupted deinstallation process.. Automatic uninstall may no longer properly work and leave files in Program Files folder.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Handling Toast Messages

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: The toast message is like an alert box that is only shown for a couple of seconds when something happens (i.e. when the user clicks on a button, submits a form, etc.). This article describes how to deal with toast messages in Rapise.

h5.a: How to Send Special Keys to Selenium Targets

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Sometimes you need to press Tab, Return, Backspace to the web page. Here is how you may do it through WebDriver.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Using Extra Columns in RVL to add Report Attributes

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: You may use extra RVL columns for your own purposes. In the simple case for storing additional information (notes, links). In more advanced cases extra columns may affect script behavior: add report attributes, control screenshots, control custom actions, assign variable values etc. Here we provide live example of one of such use-cases.

h5.a: Writing data to an Excel spreadsheet

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: In this article we describe how to write data to an external Excel spreadsheet during test playback. Both RVL and JavaScript examples are given.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Multiple Object Locators

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Sometimes object location is unstable. The same object may be identified by different location path or XPath depending on application version or state.

h5.a: How To Pass Shift+Control+F12 or Shift+Control+F11 from Rapise

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Global.DoSendKeys is a way to to that, but there is also a little trick required to make it happen.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to deal with dynamic window titles

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Desktop applications may use window titles to show important information to a user. In some cases the title contains subject of a displayed entity or time. Since Rapise uses window title while searching for an object during playback - the search may fail. This complication may be resolved if you replace recorded windows title with a regular expression.

h5.a: How to relearn an object

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: If an object can not be found at playback and it is obvious that object location has changed because of application update (differs from the case when location is dynamic!) then the best way to fix the test is simply relearn the object.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to master a dynamic locator with RVL

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: There are situations when object location attribute depends on the object data and it is not possible to record/learn all such objects in advance. In this case it may be convenient to calculate object location at playback time using FormatString and SetLocatorOpts actions of the RVL global object.

h5.a: How to save/load DOM tree in Web Spy

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Better to see something once than to hear about it a thousand times. If a Web element can not be found on the page using given XPATH expression and you do not know why - you have an option to save the DOM tree of the page and ask someone else with Rapise for assistance. Here is how.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to save type information for UI control in Rapise Spy

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Rapise supports many standard UI controls out-of-the-box. And there are even more custom UI controls that are not supported. This is why Rapise has a well-defined way of adding extensions. To add support for a custom control first it makes sense to Spy on it. If you are dealing with Managed or Java applications you can Save Type Information for the control and also save UI tree structure/properties to a file. Send this information to Rapise team to get an advice on how to add support for the new control.

h5.a: Firefox 64 Compatibility

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Once you have your Firefox updated to version 64 Rapise may have problems connecting to it. Here is a quick workaround until new release of Rapise addressing the problem shows up.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Is it Possible to Automate an iOS Web App using Rapise?

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Yes, in general, Rapise can automate most web applications using mobile Safari running on iOS (either on a real or simulated device). However there are some limitations.

h5.a: How to manipulate browser cookies using Selenium API in Rapise

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: If you run Rapise tests via Selenium WeDriver you may need to manipulate browser cookies. Learn how from this post.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: WPF Calendar and DatePicker

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: It is tricky do deal with WPF calendar control. Here we introduce a number of supplementatry functions to copy in your project and use to modify and read Calendar and DatePicker data.

h5.a: Is it Possible to Automate an iOS App Store App using Rapise?

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: We often get asked this question: "We have Rapise and want to automate a native iOS app that is available on the application store", can we do it?

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to ensure that a Fast Tab is expanded and scrolled into view in Dynamics AX

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word

span.span: Many views in Dynamics AX have several collapsible panes: General, Addresses, Contact information, etc. They are also known as Fast Tabs. Learn how to ensure that a Fast Tab is expanded and scrolled into view before entering data into the fields in this tab.

h5.a: If recording of actions in Dynamics AX or Dynamics NAV does not work

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: More and more computers are equipped with High DPI displays. Though high resolution looks beautiful it may bring some issues. One of them is broken recording in Rapise.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to upgrade Rapise to a newer version

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Rapise is evolving product and we release new versions of it from time to time. If you plan to upgrade your copy of Rapise follow these simple steps.

h5.a: How to emulate keyboard and mouse via Selenium API in Rapise

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Though Rapise can execute it's native recorded tests via WebDriver - some users prefer to write their tests in pure Selenium API. In this post we describe how to perform complex mouse and keyboard sequences via Selenium API in Rapise tests.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Rapise Start Page Layout Does Not Display Correctly

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Sometimes when you first install and open Rapise, the Start Page does not display correctly. This article explains the cause and solution to fix the issue.

h5.a: Mapping Spira Requirements to Test Steps in Bulk Using Excel and Rapise

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Of the unique needs of a requirements and test management system when working in the Defense industry, specifically when designing, building, and testing mission systems, is the ability to link individual test steps to the requirements. Since v5 of SpiraTest, this has been possible inside the Spira user interface, however many customers have been looking for a way to map test steps to requirements in bulk using Excel.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to configure Mobile Profile to automatically grant Android application permissions on install

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: When Appium installs an application at the beginning of a test session - Android may ask for permissions (e.g. access to media files, camera, etc.). Until such prompt is dismissed - Main activity is not launched. It prevents the test from proceeding. Learn how to configure the Mobile Profile to automatically grant required permissions on install.

h5.a: How to use specific version of Chromedriver with Appium

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: In Mobile Spy of Rapise when switching from NATIVE_APP to WEBVIEW context you may see an error message:
From this article you will learn how to fix this.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: DoClick() vs DoClick(x,y)

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: When doing mouse click from Rapise it is sometimes need to use offset coordinates. You will learn:
1. When explicit coordinates are needed
2. How to determine them

h5.a: Creating a Purchase Order in Dynamics AX

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Learn how to break down a long scenario into manageable pieces in RVL. Creating a purchase order in Dynamics AX takes many steps: start PO process, enter basic details, fill order lines, approve, receive, invoice. In RVL you can create separate sheets to implement stages of a complex test.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Display Intellisense for ActiveX and .NET Objects

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Sometimes when you are using Rapise, you have to use external ActiveX or .NET objects to perform specific actions. You can get Rapise to display intellisense for those objects.

h5.a: RPA Features of Rapise

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Robotic Process Automation (RPA) is well suited for processes that are clearly defined, repeatable and rules based. With Rapise you can create software robots that can do boring repetitive tasks and free employee time for more creative work.
Below you will find a brief description of RPA tasks that Rapise can do.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Android Testing Hints

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word

div.p: Most complex part in Mobile testing is connecting to a simulator or device. In this article we describe steps necessary to configure the testing environment.
Note: In brackets we specify versions of software components we used at the time of writing this article.

h5.a: iOS Testing Hints

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Most complex part in Mobile testing is connecting to a simulator or device. In this article we describe steps necessary to configure the testing environment.
Note: In brackets we specify versions of software components we used at the time of writing this article.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to insert an RVL step into Manual Test

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Sometimes it makes sense to automate certain steps of a Manual Test. If you prefer to implement automatic steps in RVL then include the AUTO helper function into your test.

h5.a: Processing registration Emails

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Common scenario: register a user and receive registration confirmation link by email. The most painless way for doing it.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: RPA - importing data into Dynamics AX

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: If anything can be automated - it will be automated. You can use Rapise to automate day-to-day processes within a company to free your employees for more creative and productive job. Imagine you have data from third-party system in Excel file and you want to import it into Dynamics AX instance. You have a choice either to develop a software program that does the import via Dynamics AX API or you can create an automation script in Rapise.

h5.a: How to find an object in the object tree

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: A test may contain a lot of objects. If you want to locate an object in the object tree you may use the filter box.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: What is object Location?

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: When you record a test Rapise captures UI elements with which you interact and adds them as objects to the Object Tree of a test. Each object has a Type (Button, Text, Label, Tree, Grid, ...) and Location. Rapise uses Location attribute of an object to find it in the application during test execution.

h5.a: How to check that Rapise can find an object on screen

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: When you execute a recorded test, sometimes, Rapise may not find some object on screen and display Object is not found error message in the report. If you see that the object is visible you can check if Rapise can find it or not without running the test.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: RPA - importing data into Dynamics NAV

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: If anything can be automated - it will be automated. You can use Rapise to automate day-to-day processes within a company to free your employees for more creative and productive job. Imagine you have data from third-party system in Excel file and you want to import it into Dynamics NAV instance. You have a choice either to develop a software program that does the import via Dynamics NAV API or you can create an automation script in Rapise.

h5.a: How to save content of a table/grid into a spreadsheet file

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: If you need to make a copy of data in a Table/Grid object - you may simply save it to Excel file with a single function call.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: Sample Spira-Friendly Framework with Multiple RVLs and Common Library

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Working example of test framework designed to maximize flexibility and get the most from Rapise productivity features.

h5.a: Storing Values Across Test Cases and Sessions in Rapise

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Sometimes test set requires a value passing through the sequence of test cases. Good example is User ID assigned during sign it and then used in subsequent test cases.
Another use case is when test case requires some input value that should always be unique.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to ensure that a Fast Tab is expanded and scrolled into view in Dynamics NAV

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word

p.span: Many views in Dynamics NAV have several collapsible panes: General, Lines, Invoice Details, etc. They are also known as Fast Tabs. Learn how to ensure that a Fast Tab is expanded and scrolled into view before entering data into the fields in this tab.

h5.a: How to ensure that web element is visible before interacting with it?

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Sometimes an element on a web page may be invisible because it is out of a viewport. Real user scrolls a page vertically and horizontally to reach such an element. How to achieve same behavior with Rapise?

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg

h5.a: How to define a profile for Web Application in Rapise

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Each web application is unique in terms of assigning attributes to elements and this complicates the process of generating XPath locators. Some applications assign dynamic IDs to elements, some use ARIA attributes and some do not, some values of class attribute have meaning related to element position and some just used for styling . There are also cases when an app contains hidden DOM layers which stack on top of each other. So usage of same set of attributes for generating XPath is not efficient and may lead to weak locators that break after application reloading or slight modification. To cope with these problems Rapise introduces Web App Profile. It is a simple JSON file of a defined structure that instructs Rapise how to build XPath for elements in a particular application. From this article you will learn how to define a profile for your web application.

h5.a: How to automate testing of Unified Service Desk for Microsoft Dynamics 365

div.class: is-unformatted font90 children-font90 pale mt2 mb3 sm-mb4 break-word
div.p: Unified Service Desk (USD) is a hybrid application. It is a windows desktop application with embedded browser components. Follow this guide to setup a test automation framework for USD.

div.class: clearfix visible-md visible-lg
